availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Covington merchant. Kentucky native. Married Mary Schrock Mullins. Father of John S. Mullins, Mary K. Mullins, Ellen Mullins, and Emma Mullins. Companion member of the Free Mason Kenton Council in 1856.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 4, p. 270. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 4, p. 187. Proceedings of the Grand Council of Kentucky, at a Grand Annual Communication, Held in the City of Lexington, on the Fourteenth Day of October, 1856 (Frankfort, KY: A. G. Hodges, 1856), p. 12. Kentucky Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates (1911-1955), 1916, Kenton County, file no. 15853.
